org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan

Class TestScanOperExecSmoothing

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.test.BaseTest
      • org.apache.drill.test.DrillTest
        • org.apache.drill.test.SubOperatorTest
          • org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan.BaseScanOperatorExecTest
            • org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan.TestScanOperExecSmoothing

  • public class TestScanOperExecSmoothing
extends BaseScanOperatorExecTest
    Test the ability of the scan operator to "absorb" schema changes by "smoothing" out data types and modes across readers. Schema smoothing is helpful when there is no output schema, but only works within the context of a single scan operator: it cannot help when a query has multiple scans, each in its own fragment.

      • testSchemaChange

      • testSchemaChangeNoSchemaBatch

        public void testSchemaChangeNoSchemaBatch()

      • testSchemaSmoothing

        public void testSchemaSmoothing()
        Test the ability of the scan operator to "smooth" out schema changes by reusing the type from a previous reader, if known. That is, given three readers:
        (a, b)
        (b)
        (a, b)
        Then the type of column a should be preserved for the second reader that does not include a. This works if a is nullable. If so, a's type will be used for the empty column, rather than the usual nullable int.

        Full testing of smoothing is done in {#link TestScanProjector}. Here we just make sure that the smoothing logic is available via the scan operator.
